MODULE.name: Intent
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: The Intent API provides an inter-application broadcast message-passing framework.
MODULE.MORE_HELP:
## Enabling the API This API is part of the `coreapi` extension that is included automatically. :::ruby extensions: ["coreapi"]
## JavaScript Usage Be sure to review the [JavaScript API Usage](/guide/api_js) guide for important information about using this API in JavaScript.
## Ruby Usage Be sure to review the [Ruby API Usage](/guide/api_ruby) guide for important information about using this API in Ruby.

METHOD.name: send
METHOD.DESC: Send intent. NOTE: On Android, the callback should only be used when the intentType is set to START_ACTIVITY.

VALUE.DESC: Use the intent as broadcast intent.
Use the intent to start a UI activity.
Use the intent to start a background service.

PARAM.name: permission
PARAM.DESC: Permission used to send a broadcast intent.

PARAM.name: action
PARAM.DESC: Intent action. See android docs for possible values: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent.html#setAction(java.lang.String).

PARAM.name: categories
PARAM.DESC: List of intent categories. See android docs for possible values: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent.html#addCategory(java.lang.String).

PARAM.name: appName
PARAM.DESC: Explicit name of the application on the device to run. It depends from platform. On iOS it is BundleURLScheme of executed application. On Android it is application package name.

PARAM.name: targetClass
PARAM.DESC: Explicit name of the class in the application wich will receive the intent. Must be specified if and only if 'appName' is defined.

PARAM.name: uri
PARAM.DESC: Open the application associated with the URI. Behavior may be different on different platforms and depend on installed software. For example, open URL with http:// prefix usually executes the Web Browser installed on system and open URL in executed browser.

PARAM.name: mimeType
PARAM.DESC: MIME type of data defined in the intent.

PARAM.name: data
PARAM.DESC: Data which will be sent within the intent. We don't support data like data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4AAQSkZ.

CALLBACK.DESC: Same format as 'params' argument and some additional values described below. Android: Developer has to ensure that the response is addressed to this call because of possible conflicts in integer request code with other extensions.

PARAM.name: responseCode
PARAM.DESC: Response code passed to Android Activity.setResult() method.

CALLBACK.DESC: Same format as 'params' argument passed to Rho.Intent.send method Android: Developer has to ensure that an intent passed to handler is what he intended to proceed since any other intent may also be passed here.
